timeline.bodyText: Do we need this to be a notice or can it be a normal note? Shall we just say something like "For production environments, we recommend Traefik (2.2.1 or later), Apache or Voyager ingress controllers, or the load balancer provided by your cloud provider"? Not sure if we need to explicitly say support of Traefik 2.2.1 in production.

replies.bodyText: @ankedia, based on your tests of Traefik is it still true that we recommend Apache or Voyager? This ends up implying more than we might mean when we say that we now support Traefik but that the others are recommended.
replies.author: rjeberhard

replies.bodyText: @rjeberhard The goal for my testing in OWLS-83015 was to ensure that Traefik doesn't exhibit any request or session data loss. It was in response to a customer query for data behind recommending Traefik only in dev or test environments. Additionally, I captured and compared txn/sec and response times numbers of Traefik and Apache. The results are documented in wiki mentioned in OWLS-83015, I didn't observe significant difference between Traefik and Apache numbers. I was not involved in original recommendation in this note and have not run stress tests with Voyager. Based on my testing, we can recommend Traefik in production. I assume recommendation for Apache and Voyager still holds true.

replies.bodyText: @ankedia If @rjeberhard agrees, I will implement your suggested re-wording, ""For production environments, we recommend Traefik (2.2.1 or later), Apache or Voyager ingress controllers, or the load balancer provided by your cloud provider."
